English: Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu School
One of only two jujutsu-education facilities in the country.
Sanskrit: देशे केवलयोः द्वयोः ऐन्द्रजाल-विद्या-संस्थयोः अन्यतमा पाठशाला।

English: (The facade is of a private religious school.)
Whoa! It is in the mountains?
Is this really Tokyo?
This isn't actually out of the ordinary for a tokyo suburb.
What about Fushiguro?
He's fast asleep after receiving jutsu treatment.
Even after graduation, many jujutsu sorcerers use the facility as a home base.
Sanskrit: शिक्षणान्तरमपि ऐंद्रजालिकाः इदं स्थलं केन्द्रकार्यालयवत् उपयुञ्जते।

English: It is a cornerstone that not only serves as a place of education, but provides mediation for missions and general support for the jujutsu community.
Sanskrit: स्थलमिदम् आधारशिला अस्ति न केवलं शिक्षार्थम् अपितु नियोगानां कृते सुचनार्थं ऐन्द्रजालिक-समाजस्य कृते समर्थनार्थं च।

English: First things, first, yuji - you've got an interview with the principal.
Sanskrit: प्रथमं तु प्रधानाचार्यद्वारा तव साक्षात्कारो भविष्यति।

English: The principal?
If you mess up, you might get rejected for admission, so stay frosty, okay?
Sanskrit: साक्षात्कारः असमीचिनः भविष्यति चेत् तव प्रवेशं निरस्तीभवेत्। अतः सावधानीभव, अवगतम्?

English: What?
Does that mean I get executed right away?
Sanskrit: अर्थात् सत्वरं मह्यं मरणदण्डः विहितः भविता किम्?

English: What a disappointment...I thought you were the leader...
Sanskrit: निराशजनकमेतत्। भवान् एव नेता इति मतं मया।

English: A heirarchy not based purely on strength is boring, if you ask me.
Sanskrit: पदानुक्रमः बले पूर्णतया न आधारितश्चेत् नीरसः अस्ति।

English: sorry, sensei, he comes out sometimes.
What an interesting body you have now.
I owe you a debt, after all.
Not again.
When I make this kid's body mine...
...You'll be the first one I kill.
Me, a target of the great sukuna? What an honor!
Sanskrit: विख्यातः सुकुनः मां लक्षीकरोति इति सम्मानाय।

English: So he really is famous?
Ryomen Sukuna, with four arms and two faces, is a demon of legend.
The truth is, he was a human who actually existed, but that was over a 1000 years ago.
Sanskrit: यथार्थं तु सः सहस्राद् वर्षेभ्यः पूर्वम् मानव आसीत्।

English: In the golden age of jujutsu, jujutsu sorcerers had sharpened their skills against him, but were ultimately defeated.
Sanskrit: इन्द्रजालस्य सुवर्णयुगे ऐन्द्रजालिकाः तं सुकुनं विरुध्य स्वकौशलं वर्धितवन्तः किन्तु तेन पराजिताः जाताः।

English: With the title ryomen sukuna, he would traverse the ages after his death as a cursed object. We jujutsu sorcerers couldn't even be able to destroy his remains preserved in their own grave wax.
Sanskrit: मरणानन्तरं रियोमेन-सुकुनः इति नाम्ना युगानि अभिशप्वस्तु-रूपेण ततार। वयम् ऐन्द्रजालिकाः अस्माकं शवसिक्थेन अभिरक्षितं सुकुनस्य परिशेषमपि नष्टुं न शक्तवन्तः।

English: Grave wax is a waxlike fatty substance formed during the decomposition of corpses.
Sanskrit: शवसिक्थं सिक्थसदृशं शव-क्षयसमये निर्मितं मेदोयुक्त-वस्तु अस्ति।

English: Without a doubt...
He is the king of curses.
Is he stronger than you sensei?
Sanskrit: भवतः अपि स अधिकः शक्तिवान् किम् आचार्य।

English: Hm, good question.
If sukuna were to completely regain his power...
It might be a little difficult.
Would you lose?
nah, i'd win.
Satoru, you are late.
You're late by eight minutes.
I thought I told you to stop being late...
Sanskrit: विलम्बेन मा आगच्छ इति मयोक्तं किल?

English: ..but not late enough for me to get angry.
Sanskrit: न्यूनातिन्यूनं बहु विलम्बेन आगत्य मा कोपय माम् इत्यपि।

English: Jujutsu High School Principal Masamichi Yaga.
This old dude is making cute stuff.
If it is not enough to get mad about, then cut me some slack.
Sanskrit: यदि कुपितः नास्ति भवान्, किमर्थं तर्जनम्?

English: I figured you'd be making dolls anyway, so eight minutes is no big deal, right?
Sanskrit: अधुना पाञ्चालिकाः निर्माति भवान् इति ऊहितं मया अतः अष्टनिमेष-विलम्बः समस्या नास्ति किल?

English: So that is the kid?
My name is yuji itadori.
I'm into girls like Jennifer Lawrence.
Nice to meet you.
Why are you here?
For an interview.
I mean at jujutsu high.
Um..to learn jujutsu?
beyond that.
What happens after you learn about curses and the way of exorcism?
Sanskrit: शापानां वशीकरणस्य च विषये अधीत्य किं भविष्यति?

English: Well...
...I'm going to collect the remaining pieces of sukuna.
It's dangerous to leave them as is.
Sanskrit: ते भागाः त्यज्येरन् चेत् अपातो भवेत्।

English: Why?
People you don't even know...
...are dying every day because of tragic incidents, accidents, diseases.
There he goes again.
Are you saying you can't accept their deaths if it's caused by a curse?
Sanskrit: अर्थात् ते शापकारणात् म्रियन्तां चेत् न स्वीकर्तुं शक्नोषि किम्?

English: That was a last request someone made to me.
Sanskrit: कोऽपि मां प्रति अन्तिमां याचनाम् अकरोत्।

English: I am not concerned with the details - I just wanna help people.
Sanskrit: परिस्थितिः कापि भवेन् नाम केवलं परोपकारो ममाशयः।

English: Last request?
So you are gonna fight curses because someone else asked you to?
Sanskrit: केनापि त्वम् अर्थितः इत्यतः अभिशापैः युद्धं करिष्यसि।

English: Disqualified.
That's not a doll?
This is a cursed corpse.
Her name is cathy, by the way.
It is a doll infused with my curse.
Sanskrit: इयं मम अभिशापेन मया योजिता पाञ्चालिका।

English: crap.
What a heavy hit!
Is it really a doll?
People are more honest with their backs against the wall.
Sanskrit: मरणभये सति चेत् जनाः सत्यवादीनो भवन्ति।

English: Until I get a worthy answer, she will keep on attacking.
Sanskrit: साधु उत्तरं पर्यन्तं सा अनवरतं प्रहरति।

English: Look, it is not just anyone's last request.
Sanskrit: कोऽपि साधारणो मां प्रति न याचनाम् अकरोत् इति अवगन्तव्यम्।

English: My grandfather did.
Agh.
Even a family member is 'someone else', right?
That is right, it is a doll.
It is not gonna get hurt or stunned.
Jujutsu sorcerers are always close to death.
And not just their own.
They must sometimes tear apart the flesh of a curse...
...with death just visible out of the corner of their eye.
It is an unpleasant job
You have to motivated and also a bit crazy.
And you want to do it because someone else asked you to?
Sanskrit: इतरः त्वां प्रति याचनां चकार इत्यतः चिकीर्षसि?

English: Don't make me laugh.
It would've been better if you'd tole me you were doing it just to postone your execution.
Sanskrit: केवलं मरणदण्डं दीर्घयितुम् इच्छसि इति त्वया कथितं चेत् वरम् अभविष्यत्।

English: Shut up!
Is that it?
Is it gonna be your grandfather's fault...
..When you get killed by a curse?
You..
...say some terrible things, you know that?
Education includes helping students make realizations.
Sanskrit: विद्यार्थीन् ज्ञापयितुं साहाय्यं कर्तुमपि कार्यं विद्यायाम् अन्तर्गतम्।

English: I..I'm not...
It's difficult to say what your heart feels when you're about to die.
Sanskrit: मरणद्वारे मनसि किं स्याद् इति कथयितुं कष्टम् एव।

English: But I can say this for sure.
No jujutsu sorcerer dies without regret.
Sanskrit: कोऽपि ऐन्द्रजालिकः विना खेदं न म्रियते।

English: With the way things are going, you might even curse your beloved grandfather.
Sanskrit: एवं सति प्रियं पितामहं निन्दयितुम् उद्युक्तो भवेः त्वम्।

English: I'll ask you one last time...
Why are you here
I've always been good at sports and fighting.
Sanskrit: क्रीडासु द्वन्द्वयुद्धेषु च मया स्वप्रतिभा प्रदर्शिता।

English: but I've never once thought...
...that I was the only one who could do something.
Sanskrit: ...यत् किमपि कार्यमस्ति यत् मया एव कर्तुं शक्नोमि।

English: Consuming sukuna...
I know that's something only I can do.
Sanskrit: इदं कार्यं तु मया एव कर्तुं शक्नोमि।

English: Even if I could run away from my execution...
...or from the mission...
...no matter what I do-eating, taking a bath or reading manga...
Sanskrit: ...यत्किमपि करोमि - खादनं वा स्नानं वा चित्रकथापठनं वा...

English: ...It'll still be there!
I'll get depressed knowing that people might be dying because of sukuna.
Sanskrit: जनाः सुकुन-कारणात् म्रियेरन् इति ज्ञात्वा विषदे पतिष्यामि।

English: Even if none of this really involves me...
Sanskrit: अस्य सर्वस्य मया सह सम्बन्धो न स्यात् चेदपि...

English: ...There's no way I can convince myself that it's not my fault.
NO thanks.
I can't say what I'll be thinking when I die, but...
Sanskrit: मरणसमये किं चिन्तयामि इति कथयितुं न शक्ष्यामि। परन्तु...

English: I am not gonna regret the way I live.
Satoru, show him to his dorm.
and explain the security and rules to him.
hm?
You pass!
Welcome to jujutsu high!
Nice to mee...
oops, sorry!
I forgot to stop the incantation.
This is your room. You can do whatever you want with it.
Sanskrit: अयमेव तव कक्षः। कक्षस्य यत्किमपि कर्तुम् इच्छसि तत् शक्नोषि।

English: Whoa! It is huge.
The second and third-years are out right now.
Sanskrit: द्वितीयवर्षीयाः तृतीयवर्षीयाः च तु अधुना बहिः भ्रमन्ति।

English: You will meet them soon though. There's not many of them anyway.
Sanskrit: तैः सह शीघ्रमेव मेलिष्यसि। ते बहवः न।

English: Yuji, you don't need to fight you know.
Sanskrit: यूजे, अवगच्छ यत् त्वया योधनीयम् इति नैव।

English: Fushiguro and I can go and retrieve sukuna's fingers.
Sanskrit: फ़ुषिगुरौः अहं च सुकुनस्य अङ्गुलीः प्रत्याहर्तुं शक्नुवः।

English: Why don't you wait just here?
No.
I said I'd do it, didn't I?
Sanskrit: अहं करिष्यामि इति मया कथितं किल?

English: Don't make me think twice about it.
But it would be hilarious to see a beaten-up fushiguro bring the fingers to me while I relax...
Sanskrit: किन्तु व्रणिते सत्यपि सुकुनाङ्गुलीः प्रत्याहरतः फ़ुषिगुरोः दर्शनम् विश्रान्ते मयि उपहासं जनयति।

English: True.
Okay.
To be honest, there's no way you're not fighting!
Sanskrit: सत्यं कथयामि यत् त्वं न योत्स्ये इति सर्वथा नैव।

English: Hey!
Was that a test?
If they were that easy to find...
...We would've found them already.
There are some with a large over-whelming presence...
Others that keep quiet...
And some that have alteady been consumed by a cursed spirit.
With regard to searching for these things...
...It's gonna be a pain.
But now we have you.
In order to regain its power...
...The Sukuna you consumed will direct you to the whereabouts of the fingers.
Sanskrit: त्वया उपभुक्तः सः सुकुनांशः अङ्गुलीः प्रति नेष्यति।

English: You're a vessel as well...
...A radar.
We're gonna need you in the field.
I don't think the guy inside me's that considerate...
Sanskrit: मयि संलिप्तः बटुः तावान् सहकारी नैव इति मन्ये।

English: I think we'll be able to come to a win-win agreement.
Huh? You're next door?
There're a bunch of empty rooms, aren't there?
Hey!
Fushiguro!
You finally look better!
I thought it'd be more lively and fun this way.
Sanskrit: इतोऽपि उत्साहपूर्णं रुचिकरं स्यात् इति अमन्ये।

English: Think positively.
Classes and missions are more than enough!
Sanskrit: पाठाः कार्याः च पर्याप्त-मात्रात् अधिकाः भविष्यन्ति।

English: What a pain...
Anyway...it's fine!!
No, it's not...
More importantly, we're going out tomorrow.
We're going to get the third first-year student.
It took four hours just to get to Morioka.
Time to finally say goodbye to the sticks.
I'll be in Tokyo soon.
What should I do if I get scouted by a talent agent?
Sanskrit: मनोरञ्जन-क्षेत्रस्य केनचित् अन्वेषिणा अन्विष्टा स्यां चेत् किं कर्तव्यम्?

English: Like stardust promotion?
Jujutsu high first-year, Nobara Kugisaki.
Megumi Fushiguro.
He's 175 cm tall, which is a little taller than Itadori, who is still growing.
Sanskrit: अधुनापि वर्धमानतः इतादोरितः किञ्चित् अधिकः पञ्चसप्तत्युत्तरशत-शतिमान-परिमितः उन्नतः फ़ुषिगुरौः।

English: He likes reading nonfiction.
He knows Gojo from before he entered Jujutsu High.
Sanskrit: गोजाम् ऐन्द्रजालिका-पाठशाला-प्रवेशतः पूर्वम् एव ज्ञातवान् सः।

English: He likes food that pairs well with ginger and disikes red bell peppers.
Sanskrit: आर्द्रकस्य अनुरूपाणि खाद्यानि रोचन्ते तस्मै किन्तु रक्तपिप्पाली तु न।

English: He wears clothes that would be comfortable at home.
Haristyle is erratic.
